bibl.title: The Subscription in the Pauline Letters.
bibl.note: There is abundant evidence, both in the papyri and the epistolary literature, that letters frequently exhibited two hands: the body is written by the secretary and the signature, or some more elaborate postscriptum, by the author himself. These features can be found in the letters of Paul.
Bahr Gordon J., The Subscription in the Pauline Letters.
